content:
IMessageReceiver Interface

Definition

Defines methods that receive output from a scripting engine. This interface acts as a callback object to capture output that would otherwise go to the console.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("F062C7FB-53BF-4f0d-B0F6-D66C5948E63F")]
public interface IMessageReceiver

Methods

Message(String)

When implemented in a class, captures the specified output.

public void Message (string strValue);
strValue
String

The output to capture.

Remarks

An implementation of this method can send the output to any location you want. For example, it can send the output to a file, store it in a data structure, or print it to a console.
